Subject: Open Source and Homebrew Arcade
Description: Open source... video gaming?  Our volunteers have brought in cheap classic game consoles, console clones, Raspberry Pii, and Raspberry Pii like devices running various homebrew and open source games they have created. This is a great opportunity for those of us who build indie games in our free time to exchange ideas and see what other people are working on.  It's also an excellent time just to kick back with other convention participants and play a few games you've never heard of.  Speakers include:Neil Funk, William Bowen - Track: Videogaming  - Duration: 1 hour and 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: G33K Biathlon
Description:
Race to compete to finish various geeky and fitness tasks such as doing pushups and answering geek culture quiz questions. The winner is the individual who can complete all tasks the quickest!
   Speakers include:William Bowen - Track: Life  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: How to Stay Fit on the Road
Description: Panel discussion on workouts that can be done anywhere, including equipment that is compact enough to take anywhere and how to properly use it. We'll talk about different ways to anchor equipment for safety and efficiency, body weight workouts for when there are no anchors, and if time permits, a brief discussion about fitness related mobile apps.  Speakers include:William Bowen, Lana Krolikowski - Track: Life  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Fitness Boot Camp
Description: Fitness class with both cardiovascular conditioning and strength training using body weight and resistance band exercises. Come get your workout on to some geeky tunes!  Speakers include:William Bowen - Track: Life  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
